'V'
'Deploy your model'

'Visualize detections'
'Prerequisites'
"\xc2\x7 If you don't have an Azure suscription, create a free account efore you egin. Try"
'the free or paid version of Azure Machine Learning today.'
'\xc2\x7 Python 3.6 or 3.7 are supported for this feature'
"\xc2\x7 Complete the Quickstart: Get started with Azure Machine Learning if you don't"
'already have an Azure Machine Learning workspace.'
'\xc2\x7 Download and unzip the *odFridgeOjects.zip 2 data file. The dataset is annotated'
'in Pascal VOC format, where each image corresponds to an xml file. Each xml file'
'contains information on where its corresponding image file is located and also'
'contains information aout the ounding oxes and the oject laels. In order to'
'use this data, you first need to convert it to the required JSONL format as seen in'
'the Convert the downloaded data to JSONLE section of the noteook.'
